definition: outside appearance and inner reality differ (idiom); not what it seems/saying one thing but meaning sth different
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to make a clear difference between what one likes and what one hates/to have well-defined likes and dislikes
to weigh up sb's words and observe their facial expression (idiom)/to discern what sb thinks from his body language
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
Trouble issues from the mouth (idiom). A loose tongue may cause a lot of trouble.
external appearance and inner thoughts coincide (idiom); to say what one means/to think and act as one
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
